result.execSummary:
The defendant James A. Hadlock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond in the amount of $150.00 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO ARGUMENTATIVE contact with Allen Hadlock.

DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A. Hadlock

defendant.name: Hadlock, James A.
defendant.address: W7162 N. Oakwood Circle, Neshkoro, WI 54960

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:40 am case called. Defendant James A. Hadlock in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 30 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for Time served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No argumentative contact with Allen Hadlock. Terms of Agent. DNA sample. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan to include DNA surcharge & sample. Bond on file to be applied. Court will allow defendant to request early termination after 6 months.  Appeal Rights Given.

Pre-trial conference at 08-21-2015 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-02-2015 09:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:53 PM: Defendant James A. Hadlock in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not plan to contest the case and requests to speak with the State on his own.   NGP entered by Court.  ADA argues for Cash Bond w/conditions.  Statement by Def as to bond - victim now in the Navy.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
